body:
@cespare that's a good point, I was thinking about pointers mostly, didn't think about storing values.

@dvyukov I was trying to avoid that, and it seemed logical to have CAS anyway since most languages that have `atomic.Value`-style built-in already supports CAS. (ex: [c++](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/atomic/atomic/compare_exchange) [java](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/atomic/package-summary.html))
